701374f.title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 168th Street
701374f.text:
Joyce Kilmer Park (Bronx): The Lorelei Fountain, depicting the leaencary siren on Peinrich Peine's lyro, Die Lordei. Ernst Herter, sculptor. The fountain stands near the Crand
Concourse, at E. 164th Street.
The cld Pobert Simpson hcuse and barn can be seen on the
east side of the Concourse.
May Be Reprodud  about 1900

701123f-a.title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 168th Street
701123f-a.text:
Grand Concourse, The Bronx
Typical rows of apartment houses in Pronx Borough.
In older Manhattan multi-family units were known generally as tenements or flats; but when the Bronx began to decelope-with the opening of the first subway transit system 2O years ago- there appeared the modern apartnent house. Before the subway came, the Bronx had 250,0000
population; now 20 years later it has nearly 930,000.
1924 Kadel &: Herbert
